intro: Topobea trianae, commonly known as the Tepui begonia, is a flowering plant native to the tepuis of South America. It belongs to the Begoniaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky habitats, thriving in the unique microclimates of the tepui plateaus. Its leaves are usually thick and fleshy, adapted to conserve moisture in its arid environment. Topobea trianae is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated by enthusiasts of rare plants.
